title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Hi, I have a 00875 thats had liquid damage over the U7650 side of the board. 

After going through the UC, the laptop started from the battery and got into the OS but I walked away and came back to it turned off.  Not sure if the battery is drained or something else.
I don't have a spare battery to test with.

20.4v going into the board from the genuine charger.
PPBUS_G3H is boosting to 12.93v and then dropping to 3.4v repeatedly
s5_pwrgd is boosting to 5.1v then drops to 3.2v and then drops to 0v.. it then starts over again.

I get a fan twitch and the CPU is getting warm

Apologies if I should have given some basic info that I've missed in this initial post.

Any help would be appreciated

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Try to start in SMC bypass mode first.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Hi 2informaticos.. holding down the power for smc bypass doesn't seem to do anything different

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: I lied.. it just did smc bypass and started

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Start then in SMC bypass mode and check all power sensors output, pages 43-45.
Be sure first to have correct AVREF_SMC voltage.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: It turns itself off after a few seconds. Gets into the OS but thats about it before the power cuts off

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: When it cuts power, the DCIN drops to 5.2v 0.02a

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: SMC bypass doesnt seem to work either now. Fan spins full for about 2 seconds but nothing more and no screen.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Try UC again.
You can check one power sensor every time the machine turns on.
2s should be enough for one reading; no need to login to OSX.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: AVREF_SMC is 2.98v

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: so its all the vsense isense outputs I'm checking right?

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Yes, check all them.
Now is strange if doesn't start on SMC bypass too.
But check them, maybe help to make an idea.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: I'm struggling to be able to accurately check them.. They are all on the opposite side of the board. I need about 6 pairs of hands :(

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
C5409 SMC_CPU_HI_ISENSE = 30MV

C5680 SMC_CPU_VSENSE = 0.5-0.9 BOOSTING

C5605 SMC_CPU_ISENSE = 0V

C5615 SMC_GT_ISENSE = 135MV

C5682 SMC_GT_VSENSE = 0MV

C5691 SMC_SA_IMON_ISENSE = 359MV

C5631 SMC_SA_ISENSE = 0MV

C5523 SNC_3V3S5_ISENSE = 0.5V

C5518 SMC_3V3SSD_ISENSE = 0MV




C5690 - SMC_CPU_IMON_ISENSE = 0V

C5469 SMC_TPAD_ISENSE = 0V

C5508 SMC_1V2S3_ISENSE = 0V

R5489 SMC_PBUS_VSENSE = 2.1V

C5489 SMC_PBUS_VSENSE = 2.1V

C5438 SMC_BMON_ISENSE = 0V

C5533 SMC_3V3WLS_ISENSE 0V

C5459 SMC_LCDBKLT_ISENSE = 0V

C5528 SMC_3V3LCD_ISENSE = 0V

Hopefully theres something here that looks odd

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Still not working on SMC bypass?

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: It sometimes works and runs for a while, other times it starts for only 2 seconds. I?ll be away from work until Tuesday now but will carry on when I?m back. Thanks for your help so far :)

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Did you pass it again through UC?
You should have corrosion problems  still...

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: I've put the board back through the UC, PPBUS_G3H is now sitting at 0v.. So I'm guessing whatever poor connection there was has vanished now.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
There should be broken trace, or solder.

Try good flux and heat SMC and CPU.
This will not solve broken trace, but give it a try.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: I'll flux and heat the SMC with 559 flux and give the cpu a little heat without flux (I'm assuming you didn't mean flux the CPU also)

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Ive got a constant 5.2v on dc in now also

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: No different after the SMC reflow

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: I always take photos of the board before starting anything like UC.. would they help at all?

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: That's good to see where to investigate, after board is clean.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: [No message]

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: After the board went through the UC, it actually looked great. Obviously something is bad but all the liquid damage appears to be at the DC end of the board

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: When the battery is connected, I get 12.6v on PPBUS_G3H.. 0v when only on the charger though

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Puff, liquid spill close to backlight output; that's big danger for the new boards :(
Supposedly problem with USB-C controllers...

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Yeah that's quite a bit of liquid damage. Do you get 5 volts on DC in for both ports currently? How do the chargeports look currently badly burned or OK?

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
I get 5.2v on both ports. The charge ports look perfect, all the fuzzy coating came off in the UC and no pins etc are burnt or tarnished.

Any ideas?

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Ok is PP3v3_G3H present, slightly low, or missing? Being there was liquid near the CD3215s I would not surprised if they are an issue.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
PP3v3_G3H isn't present on charger (expected) or on battery. Both show 0.0v

Its near on impossible for me to test around U6990 on battery but on the charger I get 5.2v on D6905 pin 2 5.1v on pin 3
On D6990, I get 5.1v on pin 2 but 0.0v on pin 10 enable.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
PP3V3_G3H enable comes from U7000.
As SMC requires this voltage, problem should be on U7000 area, not on USB-C controllers, nor SMC.
Cannot have communication between them, without PP3V3_G3H.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Pin 27 on U7000 is a direct connection to Pin 2 of R6991 from what I can tell.
As I'm not getting anything on R6991 I wanted to look at U7000 to see if it is even getting the voltages it needs, but I'm not good enough at understanding the schematic just yet.

Could someone better than me let me know what voltages I need around U7000 to feed U7000 please. That way I can see if it needs replacing or its something feeding it thats is the issue.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Check basic voltages on U7000; P_IN, AUX_DET, VDDA/P, AUX_OK.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Thank you 2informaticos.. 

Pin 10 - P_IN = 5.16v
Pin 18 - AUX_DET = 1.28v
Pin 2 - VDDA = 1.39v
Pin 17 - VDDP = 1.39v
Pin 28 - SMC_AUX_OK = 0.0v

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Pin 2 - VDDA = 1.39v
Pin 17 - VDDP = 1.39v
Change U7000...

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Okay.. I'll give that a go.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: What should VDDA and VDDP be showing as? I'm assuming SMC_AUX_OK should be outputting something also but it looks like that needs 3v3 too

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
U7000 requires (internally generated) 5V to work.
And is not present in your case...

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Now to find a UK supplier of the chip :p

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Replaced U7000. Getting 5v on VDDA & VDDP now. Still have an issue with PPBUS_G3H as it?s jumping between 3.6v and 12.95 continuously.

I can?t get it to start in SMC bypass either, I just get a fast fan for 2 seconds and it goes off again

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Ive taken F7000 off the board to see if PPBUS_G3H fluctuates on the pin one side of the fuse when its not continuing on to the system. Its still fluctuating but not as much (or my meter can't see it) it looks like its going from 7v to 12.95v repeatedly

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
You must get stable PPBUS_G3H when F7000 is removed (pad 1).
If not, check other volyages for U7000...

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: While testing the voltages, U7000 stopped working again. I got 20.2v on pin 10,15,20 before it stopped. I ordered two U7000, so I guess I'll be changing it again

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Reflow the one you have on the board now.
Random function can be generated by bad solders...

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Tried that but no change. Just trying the second one now

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: The other one was giving a happy dance while reflowing so it should have been okay solder wise.. I probably poked something I shouldn't while testing I imagine

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: New one on and back to 20.2v but still have PPBUS_G3H fluctuating on pin 1 of F7000

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Post again basic voltages for U7000.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
VDDA Pin 2 - 5.02v
VDDP Pin 17 - 5.02v

PPDCIN Pin 10 - 20.2v
TBA_CSIR_N Pin 15 - 20.2v
TBA_CSIR_P Pin 20 - 20.2v

TBA_AUX_DET Pin 18 - 5.01v
SMC_AUX_OK Pin 28 - 3.396v

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
LX1 Pin 31 is fluctuating between 0v and 36mv
LX2 Pin 6 is also doing the same

Thats only with a multimeter though so it may be jumping higher but its too quick to catch

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
3V42 and SMC_RESET_L stable high?
Check for any moved component around U7000.
R7020 gets steady 20V?

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
If you mean 3v3_g3h on pin 30, that is stable at 3.396v
SMC_Reset_L is also stable at 3.396v

I can't see anything wrong around U7000

R7020 is a stable 20.2v on both sides

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
I started testing all caps and resistors on the PBUS side between U7000 and F7000, found R7062 (which should be a 1ohm 0201 resistor reading as 147ohms so U7000 probably thought there was a ton of drain with that at 147ohm.

Swapped R7062 out and now I have a solid 12.95v on PPBUS_G3H up to F7000

Now to reattach the fuse and cross my fingers :)

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message: Damn it.. I get noise to say the charger is plugged in and an apple logo for 1 second :mad:

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Seems the keyboard is interfering. If I disconnect the keyboard, it turns on fine and stays on. Power button held on maybe.

Anyone know what to short to trigger the equivalent of pressing the power button? I don't have a spare keyboard for this model.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Shorting pin 4 and 5 on the keyboard connector doesnt seem to work nor does shorting pin 1 of the non existent SW9988

Edit: For anyone else reading this, SW9988 pin 1 doesn't seem to have its pad connected to SMC_ONOFF_L so it doesnt work as a replacement for a power button when shorted to ground. Use pin 5 on the keyboard connector instead.

title: 820-00875 PPBUS_G3H boosting after liquid damage
message:
Actually it does work when I short pin 5 to ground.. new keyboard it is then

[USER="682"]2informaticos[/USER] Thank you for your help
